ratings.comment: He was fantastic! I took a POLSCI seminar class with him at UC Berkeley; he always encouraged everyone to participate and ask questions, was extremely kind and understanding, explained concepts in a clear manner, and led thoughtful discussions on difficult topics. He was also very understanding if anyone every had to miss class. Love him!

Professor Straus provides clear and organized lectures, he will not try to confuse you. Guidelines for grading were clear, also open to student questions and comments.
Thoroughly engages with the topic (human rights), was able to do my final research paper without feeling lost. You can tell he enjoys discussing the subject matter. Great professor!
I take at uc berkeley. Best teacher ever. He speaks clearly and eloquently. He clearly cares about the material and it shows. Hes not intimidating to speak to. Best experience ever.
Told us to study “main points” and midterm was on the details. Mediocre professor with hard test.

Professor Straus is one of the best professors I have taken from. His 8 week course on genocide had 4, 30 min lectures a week. Lots of reading but you can skim it and just take notes on the big pictures. The material on genocide is SO fascinating, also disturbing but has made me more well-rounded about the world. Would 100% recommend this course.

My favorite professor at UW-Madison. His course on Genocide was one of the best classes I've taken. His lectures are so interesting that you want to pay attention and take notes without it feeling like a chore. Skimming the readings and paying attention in class were enough to understand the material and do well in this course.

Honestly a bit in love with this prof, I took his course on Genocide and it was amazing. I learned a ton, he handled really difficult material in a spectacular way, and also handled the transition to online learning really, really well. I missed his lectures the most, they were the ones I always attended (and I'm someone who has trouble w that')

Really good professor - respected, passionate, and organized. Go to class because his lectures are based off these outlines, and the important information is what he says, not what is written. He really cares for his students' success though, so questions and clarification is encouraged.

There is a lot of reading, and if you don't read, then you will likely not do well on the quizzes. The TA's(At least the one I got) grades VERY harshly for the written assignments. The professor seemed nice enough and very well informed on the course topics. Wouldn't recommend though because it is too meticulous and time consuming just to do 'okay'
Professor Straus is a well-respected expert in conflict and genocide. His lectures are fascinating, gripping, and engaging. PS439 is a class you should definitely take while a student.

Prof Straus is an expert in his field and is incredibly knowledgable about human rights! He is caring, thoughtful, and insightful. I was out of town for the final and he was very accommodating to let me take it early - great man! Take his class! TAs are iffy- definitely depends on who you have and this impacts your experience.

This was my first class with Professor Straus, and I was really impressed. He is an unpretentious person who wants to push his students to think critically about situations larger than themselves. This course on human rights was organized very well, and it is evident that he cares deeply for the wellbeing of others throughout the world.
I ADORE Scott Straus. He's well read, insanely intelligent, and the best professor I've had at UW Madison. TAKE ANY OF HIS CLASSES.

Scott Straus is one of the best professors I've had at UW. His lectures are clear and easy to follow and very interesting. He is very good at fielding questions, everything from clarification, elaboration and also his opinions on things. He is very knowledgeable and you will learn so much in this class if you work for it.

The best part of this class was the T.A. I had. Scott's lectures were hard to sit through, he is a very nice and interesting person but I personally learned everything outside of class and got an A. I think this may have had something to do with the incredible T.A. I had, but class is not mandatory and I would spend that time doing the long reading

Professor Straus is great. The topic of human rights is much more complex at the international level than I could have imagined, but he made it understandable and interesting. I took it during the summer so it was a lot more work but he took that into consideration when grading. Overall awesome class.

He's clearly a very nice guy, and also really knowledgable about human rights issues. He presents things in a clear and straightforward manner, and does not use slides. However, I expected this class to be really interesting and I have instead found his lectures to drag on. Maybe the fault of the subject matter.
He is definitely HOTT!! That alone is a reason to attend class. A nice guy overall. Class was a bit difficult. TAs could have been better.
Very passionate about the material. There was a lot of reading, and the lectures were important to clarifying the material. If you do the work you can achieve an A in the class.

Did not buy or read a single book and I got a B in the class. Go to class, take decent notes, seek help from your TA when you need it and you will do fine. As a professor Straus is fine. He sometimes gets carried away because he cares about the subject matter a lot.

Professor Straus is one of the best professors I've ever had. Extremely nice, willing to talk during office hours, and an interesting lecturer. It's easy to get an AB if you do all of the required reading (of which there's a lot) and attend class regularly. Great course and professor!

Scott Straus is a great, genuine professor.  This was a first time seminar class, and it was all based around discussion of readings.  I thought many of the readings were boring, but the content is interesting.  Prof Straus is always willing to help if you have a problem, and if you show that you actually care, you'll probably get a good grade.

Strauss was a horrible professor, literally the worst I've had at UW. His lectures are long, boring, and pointless. He just reads them off the outlines he makes before class. He's much more preoccupied with his reputation than teaching his students anything worthwhile. Completely unhelpful and I learned nothing from the class. Avoid him if you can.

If you have an interest in his field I would strongly suggest taking a class taught by Scott Straus. He is incredibly intelligent and passionate about his work. His lectures can be somewhat dry, but are very important for the exams. Although a 100 level class, there is a consensus that it requires work and the tests aren't a breeze.

Straus is an incredible professor. I took the class my first semester freshmen year and his description of the department and the syllabus made me immediately want to be an IS major. He is organized, animated in lecture, and extremely knowledgeable. Do the readings because they're INTERESTING. And go to office hours.

Scott is the best professor at UW-Madison that I have encountered so far. He truly cares about his students, and is well organized and prepared. IS101 is a difficult class to teach, but Scott gets the job done. If the test scores are low, he is not afraid to curve them for his students. Take this class if you are sick of terrible professors!

I took the class in my first semester of college for fun, and it ended up to be one of the hardest but most interesting. Straus explained the syllabus well, he obviously knows a lot about the topic and shows his passion in it. Understanding was quite easy, even for an international student like me. 2 mid-terms, 1 final and a research paper.

Pretty easy course if you do all of the readings and attend every lecture/section. Section is mandatory and 20% of your grade. Final paper is a bit rough, but if you like your topic and it's fact-based it isn't that bad. Straus sometimes isn't totally clear, he talks like a valley girl but he's knowledgable.

This professor and course is a gem at this university.  Professor Straus is THE world's foremost scholar on the Rwandan genocide and that alone made this class extremely fascinating.  You will discuss world issues that no other class really dares go near, and Straus does an excellent job at outlining the material. 2 exams, and 1 paper decide grades

Straus is passionate and extremely knowledgeable about the material. Uses academic texts, memoirs, videos, and lectures to teach about the history and theory of genocide. Very unique class and sometimes depressing, always thought-provoking. Exams are essay-based and very long, also a 10 page research paper. Approachable and open to questions.

Exams are TERRIBLY written. Used a lot of double negatives and confusing wording so that you couldn't even understand what he was asking! Reading is worthless and so is lecture attendance..everything is on the outline. He is SO SELF OBSESSED. Don't take this class! It is so poorly set up. STRAUS REWRITE YOUR EXAMS!!

As an intro level course, I believe that Professor Straus structured the class well. His expectations were very clear, and the outlines he posted online were detailed. He is also very friendly and approachable. You can tell that Professor Straus is passionate about what he teaches. Overall, he creates a very positive learning environment.

Really cool guy. 318 was different than any other class I've ever taken. Straus does a good job of balancing the academic and emotional side of the cases we studied. Some lectures could get a bit boring, but it was important to have a good understanding of the cases. Would highly recommend this class if he teaches it the future.

Great guy, a total sweetheart. Lecture notes are posted online and easy to follow so if you miss a class it's no big deal. Exams are a bit difficult but the class is very interesting. The textbook is extremely dull and the course requires a lot of reading. Overall a great course and an awesome professor.

Prof. Straus means well, but I think the class was poorly-designed. The textbook was atrocious; so dry and pointless. His lectures were pretty much just his lecture outlines, so attendance was hardly useful. All in all, I think he has lot of work to do in designing the class, regardless of how he defends his teaching methods.

Fantastic professor who is clearly passionate about his field. Gives us great examples in class from the real world. Very broad, introductory course excellently taught. Enjoyed every lecture - opens your eyes to the world outside the US.

Scott is a great guy and all, but half the time I think he makes up the stuff he says. Lectures can be helpful if you are really struggling, but his lecture outlines are posted online and they are all you really need. The textbook is terrible. It wasn't too difficult of a class, although his tests are wordy and could use some work.

Before going into this class, I was almost positive I wanted to major in international studies. After taking this class, I'm positive that I don't want to. Straus does his best to make the class interesting, but make sure you have a good TA. My TA, Brad, ruined the class for me--discussion sections were not well-prepared and he was boring.

He is a world-renown scholar and his passion for global affairs is matched only by is genuine interest and care in his students. Lecture can be slow at times due to it being a 101 survey course, but office hours open the opportunity to wonderful intellectual conversations with a brilliant, caring man. Learning from him is a pleasure and a privilege

He is such a nice and smart guy who wants nothing more than to help the students understand. I thought lectures were interesting and clear. he is so approachable and reasonable. this class made me want to study international studies. i loved having him as a teacher. get barry as your TA if possible.
Super interesting class, learned a lot and makes you think about lots of current issues.

Straus is extremely knowledgeable and passionate about what he teaches. I thought the content was very interesting, but the way the lecture can sometimes get boring, but what lecture isn't? The reading can get tedious. But, again, the content gets you to think, and Straus knows his stuff and makes it relatable. He is also super adorable and kind.

Majority of the lectures were interesting.  If possible get a decent TA, mine was terrible at explaining any concepts.  Paper is easy, just get a subject that interests you.  Hardest part was  dealing with a crappy TA
Professor Straus was a decent lecturer but dumbed the class down after the first exam. Readings weren't mandatory but were helpful. Pick a topic that interests you for the paper and you will do fine.
Interesting topic but boring class. He reiterates the outline verbatum in class so not necessary to attend. It was ok.. don't go out of your way to avoid or take this class

Fantastic professor! First half of course focuses on global forces and second half focuses on specific global issues. Very interesting teacher, outlines all of his lectures so that they are easy to follow. Tests are hard, but with a good amount of studying they are manageable. HIGHLY recommend this class and this teacher!

Scott is a VERY interesting and intellectual professor. Is very knowledgable about the subjects he lectures on. Though the tests are demanding, he spells out EXACTLY what you need to know for each exam. Reading the textbook is not necessary, only when you need to find definitions for terms for the tests. Overall, a great and informative class!

I HATED this class. I was so disappointed, because I was sincerely interested in the subject. The class was unreasonably difficult and an insane amount of work for a 101 three credit class. I found the professor confusing, boring and full of himself. Especially if you aren't a freshman, TAKE THIS CLASS WITH ANOTHER PROFESSOR IF AT ALL POSSIBLE.

Professor Straus is a gift to this university. He is SO knowledgeable and widely known as an expert in his field. TAKE HIS CLASSES! He puts a lot of emphasis on the assigned readings, but if you split them up with friends it's manageable. Tests aren't too hard. He's very helpful, definitely go to his office hours! I LOVE HIM.
Great professor. Got me really interested in international studies and studying abroad. Although lots of information each lecture, I loved everything that we discussed.

Nice guy, easy to understand for the most part. As far as the class I thought it was going to be centered around what is happening in other countries, but it was more concepts involving globalization, which was not nearly as interesting
very smart. heavily dependent on outline. but other than that he is very well informed and easy to pay attention to.

Prof Straus is both adorable and knowledgeable. He literally does everything he can to make sure his students understand the material, constantly asking for questions and finding new ways to explain things. You don't have to go to class...but you should. Also: you barely use the textbook, but READ THE ARTICLES HE ASSIGNS. IT'S A LIFESAVER.

Awesome professor and interesting class. Lectures can be slightly boring at times, but it's beneficial to go if you're not into doing all the superfluous readings. Discussions are mandatory, but TAs are very helpful and nice. Take one of Prof Straus' classes if only to see his great smile. :D
All he does is win. Made me want to go to class.
He is very clear and articulate. Very straightforward and knowledgeable.

Professor Straus is extremely knowledgeable in what he teaches.  The content is pretty interesting, but the way the lecture is presented can get boring.  A lot of reading involved!!  But, again, the content is interesting, and Professor Straus knows his stuff and is also super adorable and kind.

Lots of credentials. Very smart. But very boring and unclear in his lectures. You don't need to come to class to get an A. The textbook is superfluous to the class/exam.  he's not confident on his clarity of presenting information. Pointless class. I learned very little, but was still able to get an A.

Amazing professor. Brilliant, passionate, gorgeous, helpful, fascinating. One of the best classes and professors at UW. More than willing to help students and get to know them. Tests are reasonable. Papers graded extremely fair. TAKE THIS CLASS!

Excellent professor and one of my favorite classes ever taken at UW. Granted, I am a PoliSci major. It is a very interesting class and be prepared for an in-depth discussion of the politics and history of the cases.
Passionate lecturer who cares about his students.

He looks like mr. fantastic... and is often quite humorous in lecture. A lot of great stories and material but can at times drag on. Readings are helpful but most of the material for the exams comes from class. Grade is often dependent on TA. Overall enjoyable class.

I did not like this class at all.  I found it boring and useless unless you are majoring in int st.  The professor did not explain topics in lecture in a way that was easy to understand.  Exams are blue book and answers require in depth explanation.  Lots of reading including 2 extra books for an 8-9 page comparative book review.

This is a class I genuinely enjoyed going to. Pretty challenging class, reading-intensive and the tests are very comprehensive but he is more than willing to help out students. Go to lectures and do the readings [they're long, you can skim] and you'll be fine. He's also adorable.
Good looking professor, interesting topics, major requirement.  Not bad.  Grade based on discussion attendance, 8 page paper, attend an intl lecture outside of class, midterm, and final.
Enjoyable lectures
Extremely well-spoken and entertaining to listen to. Passionate and educated...everything a professor should be. Highly recommended from a very critical student.
Amazing.

Take any class of his! He is fantastic... super friendly and smart. There's a lot of reading, but he summarizes it well in lecture, so don't miss and take very thorough notes! I got an AB and actually skipped a lot of the readings, but maybe I was lucky. Warning though: 10 page paper, but its not terrible. Sign up early because his classes fill up!

Excellent professor, truly wonderful to be able to learn about the topic of genocide from an expert. He sometimes has difficulty expressing himself, but that's because its a very difficult and complex topic. He responds to questions very well. The readings are fascinating.I also think he is quite hansom.
He's really smart, nice, and pretty funny at times. It's a really easy class and required for international studies majors. Midterm is easy.

SUCH a good professor!  He definitely knows what he's talking about and enjoys teaching others.  I had him for the genocide class and found it incredibly interesting.  He's very helpful in office hours as well... I highly recommend taking a course with him.

Very smart professor who's a worldwide expert in the field of genocide. Knows what he's talking about. Lectures are interesting enough. It's important to study overall themes from readings and lectures for the exams which are fairly challenging.

Straus is a great lecturer!  He is truly intelligent and literally a leading mind in the world on the topic of genocide. I feel like i'm learning so much from his class, it will be one of my favorites at Madison.  Take a class with him if you can!! and he is SUCH a cutie!! he does close his eyes while he talks, makes goofy jokes and smiles TONS! <3

His class is so helpful.  He explains materials very clearly and it is related to textbooks. His class might be hard if you do not do the reading, but if you all the reading assignments, the class is just fair and interesting.
loved his class, lectures very interesting and engaging. he closes his eyes when he speaks its cute lol

One of the most interesting professors at UW. He may seem uninteresting at first but he's a really great guy. He gives very clear lectures and is realy intelligent, knows a ton about Africa. Exams aren't easy but are straightforward. He's pretty serious in class but a really nice guy outside of class.

This class was taught with Prof. Pevehouse, who is a hard act to follow, but Straus did very well.  He responds well to what the students want and is a great lecturer.  He repeats things that you should be getting in your notes and provides lots of examples.  Most of them will be African, but that is his area of expertise.  I recommend him highly.
Best Poli Sci class I've taken, great professor.  Loved the class, and i recommend taking anything with Prof. Straus.
He is amazing...take a class with him if you can.
